basic.floral_language:
Crinum asiaticum
Floriography: generous, classical, loyal
Crinum asiaticum is a bulb-forming perennial plant. Bright green leaves with wavy edge, large showy flowers with delicate petals and elegant color.
Crinum asiaticum likes sunlight, but should avoid summer strong light. Flowers from May to August for 2-3 weeks. Save the bulbs after the flowers fade for the next year to geminate in spring.
basic.blooming: Flowering period May-August, viewing period 2-3 weeks

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Likes light, shade properly under summer strong light, put in places with scattered light
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce watering in winter
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply 1-2 times monthly in spring
maintenance.pruning: Remove old, diseased and dead leaves timely, remove peduncle after flowering
